functions.name: alert
functions.description: Creates an alert trigger for an indicator or strategy, with a specified frequency, when called on the latest realtime bar. To activate alerts for a script containing calls to this function, open the "Create Alert" dialog box, then select the script name and "Any alert() function call" in the "Condition" section.

functions.name: alertcondition
functions.description: Creates alert condition, that is available in Create Alert dialog. Please note, that alertcondition does NOT create an alert, it just gives you more options in Create Alert dialog. Also, alertcondition effect is invisible on chart.

functions.name: array.abs
functions.description: Returns an array containing the absolute value of each element in the original array.

functions.name: array.avg
functions.description: The function returns the mean of an array's elements.

functions.name: array.binary_search
functions.description: The function returns the index of the value, or -1 if the value is not found. The array to search must be sorted in ascending order.

functions.name: array.binary_search_leftmost
functions.description: The function returns the index of the value if it is found. When the value is not found, the function returns the index of the next smallest element to the left of where the value would lie if it was in the array. The array to search must be sorted in ascending order.

functions.name: array.binary_search_rightmost
functions.description: The function returns the index of the value if it is found. When the value is not found, the function returns the index of the element to the right of where the value would lie if it was in the array. The array must be sorted in ascending order.

functions.name: array.clear
functions.description: The function removes all elements from an array.

functions.name: array.concat
functions.description: The function is used to merge two arrays. It pushes all elements from the second array to the first array, and returns the first array.

functions.name: array.copy
functions.description: The function creates a copy of an existing array.

functions.name: array.covariance
functions.description: The function returns the covariance of two arrays.

functions.name: array.every
functions.description: Returns true if all elements of the id array are true, false otherwise.

functions.name: array.fill
functions.description: The function sets elements of an array to a single value. If no index is specified, all elements are set. If only a start index (default 0) is supplied, the elements starting at that index are set. If both index parameters are used, the elements from the starting index up to but not including the end index (default na) are set.

functions.name: array.first
functions.description: Returns the array's first element. Throws a runtime error if the array is empty.

functions.name: array.from
functions.description: The function takes a variable number of arguments with one of the types: int, float, bool, string, label, line, color, box, table, linefill, and returns an array of the corresponding type.

functions.name: array.get
functions.description: The function returns the value of the element at the specified index.

functions.name: array.includes
functions.description: The function returns true if the value was found in an array, false otherwise.

functions.name: array.indexof
functions.description: The function returns the index of the first occurrence of the value, or -1 if the value is not found.

functions.name: array.insert
functions.description: The function changes the contents of an array by adding new elements in place.

functions.name: array.join
functions.description: The function creates and returns a new string by concatenating all the elements of an array, separated by the specified separator string.

functions.name: array.last
functions.description: Returns the array's last element. Throws a runtime error if the array is empty.

functions.name: array.lastindexof
functions.description: The function returns the index of the last occurrence of the value, or -1 if the value is not found.

functions.name: array.max
functions.description: The function returns the greatest value, or the nth greatest value in a given array.

functions.name: array.median
functions.description: The function returns the median of an array's elements.

functions.name: array.min
functions.description: The function returns the smallest value, or the nth smallest value in a given array.

functions.name: array.mode
functions.description: The function returns the mode of an array's elements. If there are several values with the same frequency, it returns the smallest value.

functions.name: array.new_bool
functions.description: The function creates a new array object of bool type elements.

functions.name: array.new_box
functions.description: The function creates a new array object of box type elements.

functions.name: array.new_color
functions.description: The function creates a new array object of color type elements.

functions.name: array.new_float
functions.description: The function creates a new array object of float type elements.

functions.name: array.new_int
functions.description: The function creates a new array object of int type elements.

functions.name: array.new_label
functions.description: The function creates a new array object of label type elements.

functions.name: array.new_line
functions.description: The function creates a new array object of line type elements.

functions.name: array.new_linefill
functions.description: The function creates a new array object of linefill type elements.

functions.name: array.new_string
functions.description: The function creates a new array object of string type elements.

functions.name: array.new_table
functions.description: The function creates a new array object of table type elements.

functions.name: array.new<type>
functions.description: The function creates a new array object of <type> elements.

functions.name: array.percentile_linear_interpolation
functions.description: Returns the value for which the specified percentage of array values (percentile) are less than or equal to it, using linear interpolation.

functions.name: array.percentile_nearest_rank
functions.description: Returns the value for which the specified percentage of array values (percentile) are less than or equal to it, using the nearest-rank method.

functions.name: array.percentrank
functions.description: Returns the percentile rank of the element at the specified index.

functions.name: array.pop
functions.description: The function removes the last element from an array and returns its value.

functions.name: array.push
functions.description: The function appends a value to an array.

functions.name: array.range
functions.description: The function returns the difference between the min and max values from a given array.

functions.name: array.remove
functions.description: The function changes the contents of an array by removing the element with the specified index.

functions.name: array.reverse
functions.description: The function reverses an array. The first array element becomes the last, and the last array element becomes the first.

functions.name: array.set
functions.description: The function sets the value of the element at the specified index.

functions.name: array.shift
functions.description: The function removes an array's first element and returns its value.

functions.name: array.size
functions.description: The function returns the number of elements in an array.

functions.name: array.slice
functions.description: The function creates a slice from an existing array. If an object from the slice changes, the changes are applied to both the new and the original arrays.

functions.name: array.some
functions.description: Returns true if at least one element of the id array is true, false otherwise.

functions.name: array.sort
functions.description: The function sorts the elements of an array.

functions.name: array.sort_indices
functions.description: Returns an array of indices which, when used to index the original array, will access its elements in their sorted order. It does not modify the original array.

functions.name: array.standardize
functions.description: The function returns the array of standardized elements.

functions.name: array.stdev
functions.description: The function returns the standard deviation of an array's elements.

functions.name: array.sum
functions.description: The function returns the sum of an array's elements.

functions.name: array.unshift
functions.description: The function inserts the value at the beginning of the array.

functions.name: array.variance
functions.description: The function returns the variance of an array's elements.

functions.name: barcolor
functions.description: Set color of bars.

functions.name: bgcolor
functions.description: Fill background of bars with specified color.

functions.name: bool
functions.description: Converts the x value to a bool value. Returns false if x is na, false, or an int/float value equal to 0. Returns true for all other possible values.

functions.name: box
functions.description: Casts na to box.

functions.name: box.copy
functions.description: Clones the box object.

functions.name: box.delete
functions.description: Deletes the specified box object. If it has already been deleted, does nothing.

functions.name: box.get_bottom
functions.description: Returns the price value of the bottom border of the box.

functions.name: box.get_left
functions.description: Returns the bar index or the UNIX time (depending on the last value used for 'xloc') of the left border of the box.

functions.name: box.get_right
functions.description: Returns the bar index or the UNIX time (depending on the last value used for 'xloc') of the right border of the box.

functions.name: box.get_top
functions.description: Returns the price value of the top border of the box.

functions.name: box.new
functions.description: Creates a new box object.

functions.name: box.set_bgcolor
functions.description: Sets the background color of the box.

functions.name: box.set_border_color
functions.description: Sets the border color of the box.

functions.name: box.set_border_style
functions.description: Sets the border style of the box.

functions.name: box.set_border_width
functions.description: Sets the border width of the box.

functions.name: box.set_bottom
functions.description: Sets the bottom coordinate of the box.

functions.name: box.set_bottom_right_point
functions.description: Sets the bottom-right corner location of the id box to point.

functions.name: box.set_extend
functions.description: Sets extending type of the border of this box object. When extend.none is used, the horizontal borders start at the left border and end at the right border. With extend.left or extend.right, the horizontal borders are extended indefinitely to the left or right of the box, respectively. With extend.both, the horizontal borders are extended on both sides.

functions.name: box.set_left
functions.description: Sets the left coordinate of the box.

functions.name: box.set_lefttop
functions.description: Sets the left and top coordinates of the box.

functions.name: box.set_right
functions.description: Sets the right coordinate of the box.

functions.name: box.set_rightbottom
functions.description: Sets the right and bottom coordinates of the box.

functions.name: box.set_text
functions.description: The function sets the text in the box.

functions.name: box.set_text_color
functions.description: The function sets the color of the text inside the box.

functions.name: box.set_text_font_family
functions.description: The function sets the font family of the text inside the box.

functions.name: box.set_text_formatting
functions.description: Sets the formatting attributes the drawing applies to displayed text.

functions.name: box.set_text_halign
functions.description: The function sets the horizontal alignment of the box's text.

functions.name: box.set_text_size
functions.description: The function sets the size of the box's text.

functions.name: box.set_text_valign
functions.description: The function sets the vertical alignment of a box's text.

functions.name: box.set_text_wrap
functions.description: The function sets the mode of wrapping of the text inside the box.

functions.name: box.set_top
functions.description: Sets the top coordinate of the box.

functions.name: box.set_top_left_point
functions.description: Sets the top-left corner location of the id box to point.

functions.name: box.set_xloc
functions.description: Sets the left and right borders of a box and updates its xloc property.

functions.name: chart.point.copy
functions.description: Creates a copy of a chart.point object with the specified id.

functions.name: chart.point.from_index
functions.description: Returns a chart.point object with index as its x-coordinate and price as its y-coordinate.

functions.name: chart.point.from_time
functions.description: Returns a chart.point object with time as its x-coordinate and price as its y-coordinate.

functions.name: chart.point.new
functions.description: Creates a new chart.point object with the specified time, index, and price.

functions.name: chart.point.now
functions.description: Returns a chart.point object with price as the y-coordinate

functions.name: color
functions.description: Casts na to color

functions.name: color.b
functions.description: Retrieves the value of the color's blue component.

functions.name: color.from_gradient
functions.description: Based on the relative position of value in the bottom_value to top_value range, the function returns a color from the gradient defined by bottom_color to top_color.

functions.name: color.g
functions.description: Retrieves the value of the color's green component.

functions.name: color.new
functions.description: Function color applies the specified transparency to the given color.

functions.name: color.r
functions.description: Retrieves the value of the color's red component.

functions.name: color.rgb
functions.description: Creates a new color with transparency using the RGB color model.

functions.name: color.t
functions.description: Retrieves the color's transparency.

functions.name: fill
functions.description: Fills background between two plots or hlines with a given color.

functions.name: fixnan
functions.description: For a given series replaces NaN values with previous nearest non-NaN value.

functions.name: float
functions.description: Casts na to float

functions.name: hline
functions.description: Renders a horizontal line at a given fixed price level.

functions.name: indicator
functions.description: This declaration statement designates the script as an indicator and sets a number of indicator-related properties.

functions.name: input
functions.description: Adds an input to the Inputs tab of your script's Settings, which allows you to provide configuration options to script users. This function automatically detects the type of the argument used for 'defval' and uses the corresponding input widget.

functions.name: input.bool
functions.description: Adds an input to the Inputs tab of your script's Settings, which allows you to provide configuration options to script users. This function adds a checkmark to the script's inputs.

functions.name: input.color
functions.description: Adds an input to the Inputs tab of your script's Settings, which allows you to provide configuration options to script users. This function adds a color picker that allows the user to select a color and transparency, either from a palette or a hex value.

functions.name: input.enum
functions.description: Adds an input to the Inputs tab of your script's Settings, which allows you to provide configuration options to script users. This function adds a dropdown with options based on the enum fields passed to its defval and options parameters.

functions.name: input.float
functions.description: Adds an input to the Inputs tab of your script's Settings, which allows you to provide configuration options to script users. This function adds a field for a float input to the script's inputs.

functions.name: input.int
functions.description: Adds an input to the Inputs tab of your script's Settings, which allows you to provide configuration options to script users. This function adds a field for an integer input to the script's inputs.

functions.name: input.price
functions.description: Adds a price input to the script's "Settings/Inputs" tab. Using confirm = true activates the interactive input mode where a price is selected by clicking on the chart.

functions.name: input.session
functions.description: Adds an input to the Inputs tab of your script's Settings, which allows you to provide configuration options to script users. This function adds two dropdowns that allow the user to specify the beginning and the end of a session using the session selector and returns the result as a string.

functions.name: input.source
functions.description: Adds an input to the Inputs tab of your script's Settings, which allows you to provide configuration options to script users. This function adds a dropdown that allows the user to select a source for the calculation, e.g. close, hl2, etc. The user can also select an output from another indicator on their chart as the source.

functions.name: input.string
functions.description: Adds an input to the Inputs tab of your script's Settings, which allows you to provide configuration options to script users. This function adds a field for a string input to the script's inputs.

functions.name: input.symbol
functions.description: Adds an input to the Inputs tab of your script's Settings, which allows you to provide configuration options to script users. This function adds a field that allows the user to select a specific symbol using the symbol search and returns that symbol, paired with its exchange prefix, as a string.

functions.name: input.text_area
functions.description: Adds an input to the Inputs tab of your script's Settings, which allows you to provide configuration options to script users. This function adds a field for a multiline text input.

functions.name: input.time
functions.description: Adds a time input to the script's "Settings/Inputs" tab. This function adds two input widgets on the same line: one for the date and one for the time. The function returns a date/time value in UNIX format. Using confirm = true activates the interactive input mode where a point in time is selected by clicking on the chart.

functions.name: input.timeframe
functions.description: Adds an input to the Inputs tab of your script's Settings, which allows you to provide configuration options to script users. This function adds a dropdown that allows the user to select a specific timeframe via the timeframe selector and returns it as a string. The selector includes the custom timeframes a user may have added using the chart's Timeframe dropdown.

functions.name: int
functions.description: Casts na or truncates float value to int

functions.name: label
functions.description: Casts na to label

functions.name: label.copy
functions.description: Clones the label object.

functions.name: label.delete
functions.description: Deletes the specified label object. If it has already been deleted, does nothing.

functions.name: label.get_text
functions.description: Returns the text of this label object.
functions.returnType: String object containing the text of this label.

functions.name: label.get_x
functions.description: Returns UNIX time or bar index (depending on the last xloc value set) of this label's position.

functions.name: label.get_y
functions.description: Returns price of this label's position.

functions.name: label.new
functions.description: Creates new label object.

functions.name: label.set_color
functions.description: Sets label border and arrow color.

functions.name: label.set_point
functions.description: Sets the location of the id label to point.

functions.name: label.set_size
functions.description: Sets arrow and text size of the specified label object.

functions.name: label.set_style
functions.description: Sets label style.

functions.name: label.set_text
functions.description: Sets label text

functions.name: label.set_text_font_family
functions.description: The function sets the font family of the text inside the label.

functions.name: label.set_text_formatting
functions.description: Sets the formatting attributes the drawing applies to displayed text.

functions.name: label.set_textalign
functions.description: Sets the alignment for the label text.

functions.name: label.set_textcolor
functions.description: Sets color of the label text.

functions.name: label.set_tooltip
functions.description: Sets the tooltip text.

functions.name: label.set_x
functions.description: Sets bar index or bar time (depending on the xloc) of the label position.

functions.name: label.set_xloc
functions.description: Sets x-location and new bar index/time value.

functions.name: label.set_xy
functions.description: Sets bar index/time and price of the label position.

functions.name: label.set_y
functions.description: Sets price of the label position

functions.name: label.set_yloc
functions.description: Sets new y-location calculation algorithm.

functions.name: library
functions.description: Declaration statement identifying a script as a library.

functions.name: line
functions.description: Casts na to line

functions.name: line.copy
functions.description: Clones the line object.

functions.name: line.delete
functions.description: Deletes the specified line object. If it has already been deleted, does nothing.

functions.name: line.get_price
functions.description: Returns the price level of a line at a given bar index.

functions.name: line.get_x1
functions.description: Returns UNIX time or bar index (depending on the last xloc value set) of the first point of the line.

functions.name: line.get_x2
functions.description: Returns UNIX time or bar index (depending on the last xloc value set) of the second point of the line.

functions.name: line.get_y1
functions.description: Returns price of the first point of the line.

functions.name: line.get_y2
functions.description: Returns price of the second point of the line.

functions.name: line.new
functions.description: Creates new line object.

functions.name: line.set_color
functions.description: Sets the line color

functions.name: line.set_extend
functions.description: Sets extending type of this line object. If extend=extend.none, draws segment starting at point (x1, y1) and ending at point (x2, y2). If extend is equal to extend.right or extend.left, draws a ray starting at point (x1, y1) or (x2, y2), respectively. If extend=extend.both, draws a straight line that goes through these points.

functions.name: line.set_first_point
functions.description: Sets the first point of the id line to point.

functions.name: line.set_second_point
functions.description: Sets the second point of the id line to point.

functions.name: line.set_style
functions.description: Sets the line style

functions.name: line.set_width
functions.description: Sets the line width.

functions.name: line.set_x1
functions.description: Sets bar index or bar time (depending on the xloc) of the first point.

functions.name: line.set_x2
functions.description: Sets bar index or bar time (depending on the xloc) of the second point.

functions.name: line.set_xloc
functions.description: Sets x-location and new bar index/time values.

functions.name: line.set_xy1
functions.description: Sets bar index/time and price of the first point.

functions.name: line.set_xy2
functions.description: Sets bar index/time and price of the second point

functions.name: line.set_y1
functions.description: Sets price of the first point

functions.name: line.set_y2
functions.description: Sets price of the second point.

functions.name: linefill
functions.description: Casts na to linefill.

functions.name: linefill.delete
functions.description: Deletes the specified linefill object. If it has already been deleted, does nothing.

functions.name: linefill.get_line1
functions.description: Returns the ID of the first line used in the id linefill.

functions.name: linefill.get_line2
functions.description: Returns the ID of the second line used in the id linefill.

functions.name: linefill.new
functions.description: Creates a new linefill object and displays it on the chart, filling the space between line1 and line2 with the color specified in color.

functions.name: linefill.set_color
functions.description: The function sets the color of the linefill object passed to it.

functions.name: log.error
functions.description: Converts the formatting string and value(s) into a formatted string, and sends the result to the "Pine logs" menu tagged with the "error" debug level.

functions.name: log.info
functions.description: Converts the formatting string and value(s) into a formatted string, and sends the result to the "Pine logs" menu tagged with the "info" debug level.

functions.name: log.warning
functions.description: Converts the formatting string and value(s) into a formatted string, and sends the result to the "Pine logs" menu tagged with the "warning" debug level.

functions.name: map.clear
functions.description: Clears the map, removing all key-value pairs from it.

functions.name: map.contains
functions.description: Returns true if the key was found in the id map, false otherwise.

functions.name: map.copy
functions.description: Creates a copy of an existing map.

functions.name: map.get
functions.description: Returns the value associated with the specified key in the id map.

functions.name: map.keys
functions.description: Returns an array of all the keys in the id map. The resulting array is a copy and any changes to it are not reflected in the original map.

functions.name: map.new<type,type>
functions.description: Creates a new map object: a collection that consists of key-value pairs, where all keys are of the keyType, and all values are of the valueType.

functions.name: map.put
functions.description: Puts a new key-value pair into the id map.

functions.name: map.put_all
functions.description: Puts all key-value pairs from the id2 map into the id map.

functions.name: map.remove
functions.description: Removes a key-value pair from the id map.

functions.name: map.size
functions.description: Returns the number of key-value pairs in the id map.

functions.name: map.values
functions.description: Returns an array of all the values in the id map. The resulting array is a copy and any changes to it are not reflected in the original map.

functions.name: math.abs
functions.description: Absolute value of number is number if number >= 0, or -number otherwise.

functions.name: math.acos
functions.description: The acos function returns the arccosine (in radians) of number such that cos(acos(y)) = y for y in range [-1, 1].

functions.name: math.asin
functions.description: The asin function returns the arcsine (in radians) of number such that sin(asin(y)) = y for y in range [-1, 1].

functions.name: math.atan
functions.description: The atan function returns the arctangent (in radians) of number such that tan(atan(y)) = y for any y.

functions.name: math.avg
functions.description: Calculates average of all given series (elementwise).

functions.name: math.ceil
functions.description: Rounds the specified number up to the smallest whole number ("int" value) that is greater than or equal to it.

functions.name: math.cos
functions.description: The cos function returns the trigonometric cosine of an angle.

functions.name: math.exp
functions.description: The exp function of number is e raised to the power of number, where e is Euler's number.

functions.name: math.floor
functions.description: Rounds the specified number down to the largest whole number ("int" value) that is less than or equal to it.

functions.name: math.log
functions.description: Natural logarithm of any number > 0 is the unique y such that e^y = number.

functions.name: math.log10
functions.description: The common (or base 10) logarithm of number is the power to which 10 must be raised to obtain the number. 10^y = number.

functions.name: math.max
functions.description: Returns the greatest of multiple values.

functions.name: math.min
functions.description: Returns the smallest of multiple values.

functions.name: math.pow
functions.description: Mathematical power function.

functions.name: math.random
functions.description: Returns a pseudo-random value. The function will generate a different sequence of values for each script execution. Using the same value for the optional seed argument will produce a repeatable sequence.

functions.name: math.round
functions.description: Returns the value of number rounded to the nearest integer, with ties rounding up. If the precision parameter is used, returns a float value rounded to that amount of decimal places.

functions.name: math.round_to_mintick
functions.description: Returns the value rounded to the symbol's mintick, i.e. the nearest value that can be divided by syminfo.mintick, without the remainder, with ties rounding up.

functions.name: math.sign
functions.description: Sign (signum) of number is zero if number is zero, 1.0 if number is greater than zero, -1.0 if number is less than zero.

functions.name: math.sin
functions.description: The sin function returns the trigonometric sine of an angle.

functions.name: math.sqrt
functions.description: Square root of any number >= 0 is the unique y >= 0 such that y^2 = number.

functions.name: math.sum
functions.description: The sum function returns the sliding sum of last y values of x.

functions.name: math.tan
functions.description: The tan function returns the trigonometric tangent of an angle.

functions.name: math.todegrees
functions.description: Returns an approximately equivalent angle in degrees from an angle measured in radians.

functions.name: math.toradians
functions.description: Returns an approximately equivalent angle in radians from an angle measured in degrees.

functions.name: matrix.add_col
functions.description: The function adds a column at the column index of the id matrix. The column can consist of na values, or an array can be used to provide values.

functions.name: matrix.add_row
functions.description: The function adds a row at the row index of the id matrix. The row can consist of na values, or an array can be used to provide values.

functions.name: matrix.avg
functions.description: The function calculates the average of all elements in the matrix.

functions.name: matrix.col
functions.description: The function creates a one-dimensional array from the elements of a matrix column.

functions.name: matrix.columns
functions.description: The function returns the number of columns in the matrix.

functions.name: matrix.concat
functions.description: The function appends the m2 matrix to the m1 matrix.

functions.name: matrix.copy
functions.description: The function creates a new matrix which is a copy of the original.

functions.name: matrix.det
functions.description: The function returns the determinant of a square matrix.

functions.name: matrix.diff
functions.description: The function returns a new matrix resulting from the subtraction between matrices id1 and id2, or of matrix id1 and an id2 scalar (a numerical value).

functions.name: matrix.eigenvalues
functions.description: The function returns an array containing the eigenvalues of a square matrix.

functions.name: matrix.eigenvectors
functions.description: Returns a matrix of eigenvectors, in which each column is an eigenvector of the id matrix.

functions.name: matrix.elements_count
functions.description: The function returns the total number of all matrix elements.

functions.name: matrix.fill
functions.description: The function fills a rectangular area of the id matrix defined by the indices from_column to to_column (not including it) and from_row to to_row(not including it) with the value.

functions.name: matrix.get
functions.description: The function returns the element with the specified index of the matrix.

functions.name: matrix.inv
functions.description: The function returns the inverse of a square matrix.

functions.name: matrix.is_antidiagonal
functions.description: The function determines if the matrix is anti-diagonal (all elements outside the secondary diagonal are zero).

functions.name: matrix.is_antisymmetric
functions.description: The function determines if a matrix is antisymmetric (its transpose equals its negative).

functions.name: matrix.is_binary
functions.description: The function determines if the matrix is binary (when all elements of the matrix are 0 or 1).

functions.name: matrix.is_diagonal
functions.description: The function determines if the matrix is diagonal (all elements outside the main diagonal are zero).

functions.name: matrix.is_identity
functions.description: The function determines if a matrix is an identity matrix (elements with ones on the main diagonal and zeros elsewhere).

functions.name: matrix.is_square
functions.description: The function determines if the matrix is square (it has the same number of rows and columns).

functions.name: matrix.is_stochastic
functions.description: The function determines if the matrix is stochastic.

functions.name: matrix.is_symmetric
functions.description: The function determines if a square matrix is symmetric (elements are symmetric with respect to the main diagonal).

functions.name: matrix.is_triangular
functions.description: The function determines if the matrix is triangular (if all elements above or below the main diagonal are zero).

functions.name: matrix.is_zero
functions.description: The function determines if all elements of the matrix are zero.

functions.name: matrix.kron
functions.description: The function returns the Kronecker product for the id1 and id2 matrices.

functions.name: matrix.max
functions.description: The function returns the largest value from the matrix elements.

functions.name: matrix.median
functions.description: The function calculates the median ("the middle" value) of matrix elements.

functions.name: matrix.min
functions.description: The function returns the smallest value from the matrix elements.

functions.name: matrix.mode
functions.description: The function calculates the mode of the matrix, which is the most frequently occurring value from the matrix elements. When there are multiple values occurring equally frequently, the function returns the smallest of those values.

functions.name: matrix.mult
functions.description: The function returns a new matrix resulting from the product between the matrices id1 and id2, or between an id1 matrix and an id2 scalar (a numerical value), or between an id1 matrix and an id2 vector (an array of values).

functions.name: matrix.new<type>
functions.description: The function creates a new matrix object. A matrix is a two-dimensional data structure containing rows and columns. All elements in the matrix must be of the type specified in the type template ("<type>").

functions.name: matrix.pinv
functions.description: The function returns the pseudoinverse of a matrix.

functions.name: matrix.pow
functions.description: The function calculates the product of the matrix by itself power times.

functions.name: matrix.rank
functions.description: The function calculates the rank of the matrix.

functions.name: matrix.remove_col
functions.description: The function removes the column at column index of the id matrix and returns an array containing the removed column's values.

functions.name: matrix.remove_row
functions.description: The function removes the row at row index of the id matrix and returns an array containing the removed row's values.

functions.name: matrix.reshape
functions.description: The function rebuilds the id matrix to rows x cols dimensions.

functions.name: matrix.reverse
functions.description: The function reverses the order of rows and columns in the matrix id. The first row and first column become the last, and the last become the first.

functions.name: matrix.row
functions.description: The function creates a one-dimensional array from the elements of a matrix row.

functions.name: matrix.rows
functions.description: The function returns the number of rows in the matrix.

functions.name: matrix.set
functions.description: The function assigns value to the element at the row and column of the id matrix.

functions.name: matrix.sort
functions.description: The function rearranges the rows in the id matrix following the sorted order of the values in the column.

functions.name: matrix.submatrix
functions.description: The function extracts a submatrix of the id matrix within the specified indices.

functions.name: matrix.sum
functions.description: The function returns a new matrix resulting from the sum of two matrices id1 and id2, or of an id1 matrix and an id2 scalar (a numerical value).

functions.name: matrix.swap_columns
functions.description: The function swaps the columns at the index column1 and column2 in the id matrix.

functions.name: matrix.swap_rows
functions.description: The function swaps the rows at the index row1 and row2 in the id matrix.

functions.name: matrix.trace
functions.description: The function calculates the trace of a matrix (the sum of the main diagonal's elements).

functions.name: matrix.transpose
functions.description: The function creates a new, transposed version of the id. This interchanges the row and column index of each element.

functions.name: max_bars_back
functions.description: Function sets the maximum number of bars that is available for historical reference of a given built-in or user variable. When operator '[]' is applied to a variable - it is a reference to a historical value of that variable.

functions.name: na
functions.description: Tests if x is na.

functions.name: nz
functions.description: Replaces NaN values with zeros (or given value) in a series.

functions.name: plot
functions.description: Plots a series of data on the chart.

functions.name: plotarrow
functions.description: Plots up and down arrows on the chart. Up arrow is drawn at every indicator positive value, down arrow is drawn at every negative value. If indicator returns na then no arrow is drawn. Arrows has different height, the more absolute indicator value the longer arrow is drawn.

functions.name: plotbar
functions.description: Plots ohlc bars on the chart.

functions.name: plotcandle
functions.description: Plots candles on the chart.

functions.name: plotchar
functions.description: Plots visual shapes using any given one Unicode character on the chart.

functions.name: plotshape
functions.description: Plots visual shapes on the chart.

functions.name: polyline.delete
functions.description: Deletes the specified polyline object. It has no effect if the id doesn't exist.

functions.name: polyline.new
functions.description: Creates a new polyline instance and displays it on the chart, sequentially connecting all of the points in the points array with line segments. The segments in the drawing can be straight or curved depending on the curved parameter.

functions.name: request.currency_rate
functions.description: Provides a daily rate that can be used to convert a value expressed in the from currency to another in the to currency.

functions.name: request.dividends
functions.description: Requests dividends data for the specified symbol.

functions.name: request.earnings
functions.description: Requests earnings data for the specified symbol.

functions.name: request.economic
functions.description: Requests economic data for a symbol. Economic data includes information such as the state of a country's economy (GDP, inflation rate, etc.) or of a particular industry (steel production, ICU beds, etc.).

functions.name: request.financial
functions.description: Requests financial series for symbol.

functions.name: request.quandl
functions.description: Note: This function has been deprecated due to the API change from NASDAQ Data Link. Requests for "QUANDL" symbols are no longer valid and requests for them return a runtime error.

functions.name: request.security
functions.description: Requests the result of an expression from a specified context (symbol and timeframe).

functions.name: request.security_lower_tf
functions.description: Requests the results of an expression from a specified symbol on a timeframe lower than or equal to the chart's timeframe. It returns an array containing one element for each lower-timeframe bar within the chart bar. On a 5-minute chart, requesting data using a timeframe argument of "1" typically returns an array with five elements representing the value of the expression on each 1-minute bar, ordered by time with the earliest value first.

functions.name: request.seed
functions.description: Requests data from a user-maintained GitHub repository and returns it as a series. An in-depth tutorial on how to add new data can be found here.

functions.name: request.splits
functions.description: Requests splits data for the specified symbol.

functions.name: runtime.error
functions.description: When called, causes a runtime error with the error message specified in the message argument.

functions.name: str.contains
functions.description: Returns true if the source string contains the str substring, false otherwise.

functions.name: str.endswith
functions.description: Returns true if the source string ends with the substring specified in str, false otherwise.

functions.name: str.format
functions.description: Converts the formatting string and value(s) into a formatted string. The formatting string can contain literal text and one placeholder in curly braces {} for each value to be formatted. Each placeholder consists of the index of the required argument (beginning at 0) that will replace it, and an optional format specifier. The index represents the position of that argument in the str.format argument list.

functions.name: str.format_time
functions.description: Converts the time timestamp into a string formatted according to format and timezone.

functions.name: str.length
functions.description: Returns an integer corresponding to the amount of chars in that string.

functions.name: str.lower
functions.description: Returns a new string with all letters converted to lowercase.

functions.name: str.match
functions.description: Returns the new substring of the source string if it matches a regex regular expression, an empty string otherwise.

functions.name: str.pos
functions.description: Returns the position of the first occurrence of the str string in the source string, 'na' otherwise.

functions.name: str.repeat
functions.description: Constructs a new string containing the source string repeated repeat times with the separator injected between each repeated instance.

functions.name: str.replace
functions.description: Returns a new string with the Nth occurrence of the target string replaced by the replacement string, where N is specified in occurrence.

functions.name: str.replace_all
functions.description: Replaces each occurrence of the target string in the source string with the replacement string.

functions.name: str.split
functions.description: Divides a string into an array of substrings and returns its array id.

functions.name: str.startswith
functions.description: Returns true if the source string starts with the substring specified in str, false otherwise.

functions.name: str.substring
functions.description: Returns a new string that is a substring of the source string. The substring begins with the character at the index specified by begin_pos and extends to 'end_pos - 1' of the source string.

functions.name: str.tonumber
functions.description: Converts a value represented in string to its "float" equivalent.

functions.name: str.trim
functions.description: Constructs a new string with all consecutive whitespaces and other control characters (e.g., \n, \t, etc.) removed from the left and right of the source.

functions.name: str.upper
functions.description: Returns a new string with all letters converted to uppercase.

functions.name: strategy
functions.description: This declaration statement designates the script as a strategy and sets a number of strategy-related properties.

functions.name: strategy.cancel
functions.description: Cancels a pending or unfilled order with a specific identifier. If multiple unfilled orders share the same ID, calling this command with that ID as the id argument cancels all of them. If a script calls this command with an id representing the ID of a filled order, it has no effect.

functions.name: strategy.cancel_all
functions.description: Cancels all pending or unfilled orders, regardless of their identifiers.

functions.name: strategy.close
functions.description: Creates an order to exit from the part of a position opened by entry orders with a specific identifier. If multiple entries in the position share the same ID, the orders from this command apply to all those entries, starting from the first open trade, when its calls use that ID as the id argument.

functions.name: strategy.close_all
functions.description: Creates an order to close an open position completely, regardless of the identifiers of the entry orders that opened or added to it.

functions.name: strategy.closedtrades.commission
functions.description: Returns the sum of entry and exit fees paid in the closed trade, expressed in strategy.account_currency.

functions.name: strategy.closedtrades.entry_bar_index
functions.description: Returns the bar_index of the closed trade's entry.

functions.name: strategy.closedtrades.entry_comment
functions.description: Returns the comment message of the closed trade's entry, or na if there is no entry with this trade_num.

functions.name: strategy.closedtrades.entry_id
functions.description: Returns the id of the closed trade's entry.

functions.name: strategy.closedtrades.entry_price
functions.description: Returns the price of the closed trade's entry.

functions.name: strategy.closedtrades.entry_time
functions.description: Returns the UNIX time of the closed trade's entry, expressed in milliseconds..

functions.name: strategy.closedtrades.exit_bar_index
functions.description: Returns the bar_index of the closed trade's exit.

functions.name: strategy.closedtrades.exit_comment
functions.description: Returns the comment message of the closed trade's exit, or na if there is no entry with this trade_num.

functions.name: strategy.closedtrades.exit_id
functions.description: Returns the id of the closed trade's exit.

functions.name: strategy.closedtrades.exit_price
functions.description: Returns the price of the closed trade's exit.

functions.name: strategy.closedtrades.exit_time
functions.description: Returns the UNIX time of the closed trade's exit, expressed in milliseconds.

functions.name: strategy.closedtrades.max_drawdown
functions.description: Returns the maximum drawdown of the closed trade, i.e., the maximum possible loss during the trade, expressed in strategy.account_currency.

functions.name: strategy.closedtrades.max_drawdown_percent
functions.description: Returns the maximum drawdown of the closed trade, i.e., the maximum possible loss during the trade, expressed as a percentage and calculated by formula: Lowest Value During Trade / (Entry Price x Quantity) * 100.

functions.name: strategy.closedtrades.max_runup
functions.description: Returns the maximum run up of the closed trade, i.e., the maximum possible profit during the trade, expressed in strategy.account_currency.

functions.name: strategy.closedtrades.max_runup_percent
functions.description: Returns the maximum run-up of the closed trade, i.e., the maximum possible profit during the trade, expressed as a percentage and calculated by formula: Highest Value During Trade / (Entry Price x Quantity) * 100.

functions.name: strategy.closedtrades.profit
functions.description: Returns the profit/loss of the closed trade, expressed in strategy.account_currency. Losses are expressed as negative values.

functions.name: strategy.closedtrades.profit_percent
functions.description: Returns the profit/loss value of the closed trade, expressed as a percentage. Losses are expressed as negative values.

functions.name: strategy.closedtrades.size
functions.description: Returns the direction and the number of contracts traded in the closed trade. If the value is > 0, the market position was long. If the value is < 0, the market position was short.

functions.name: strategy.convert_to_account
functions.description: Converts the value from the currency that the symbol on the chart is traded in (syminfo.currency) to the currency used by the strategy (strategy.account_currency).

functions.name: strategy.convert_to_symbol
functions.description: Converts the value from the currency used by the strategy (strategy.account_currency) to the currency that the symbol on the chart is traded in (syminfo.currency).

functions.name: strategy.default_entry_qty
functions.description: Calculates the default quantity, in units, of an entry order from strategy.entry or strategy.order if it were to fill at the specified fill_price value. The calculation depends on several strategy properties, including default_qty_type, default_qty_value, currency, and other parameters in the strategy function and their representation in the "Properties" tab of the strategy's settings.

functions.name: strategy.entry
functions.description: Creates a new order to open or add to a position. If an unfilled order with the same id exists, a call to this command modifies that order.

functions.name: strategy.exit
functions.description: Creates price-based orders to exit from an open position. If unfilled exit orders with the same id exist, calls to this command modify those orders. This command can generate more than one type of exit order, depending on the specified parameters. However, it does not create market orders. To exit from a position with a market order, use strategy.close or strategy.close_all.

functions.name: strategy.opentrades.commission
functions.description: Returns the sum of entry and exit fees paid in the open trade, expressed in strategy.account_currency.

functions.name: strategy.opentrades.entry_bar_index
functions.description: Returns the bar_index of the open trade's entry.

functions.name: strategy.opentrades.entry_comment
functions.description: Returns the comment message of the open trade's entry, or na if there is no entry with this trade_num.

functions.name: strategy.opentrades.entry_id
functions.description: Returns the id of the open trade's entry.

functions.name: strategy.opentrades.entry_price
functions.description: Returns the price of the open trade's entry.

functions.name: strategy.opentrades.entry_time
functions.description: Returns the UNIX time of the open trade's entry, expressed in milliseconds.

functions.name: strategy.opentrades.max_drawdown
functions.description: Returns the maximum drawdown of the open trade, i.e., the maximum possible loss during the trade, expressed in strategy.account_currency.

functions.name: strategy.opentrades.max_drawdown_percent
functions.description: Returns the maximum drawdown of the open trade, i.e., the maximum possible loss during the trade, expressed as a percentage and calculated by formula: Lowest Value During Trade / (Entry Price x Quantity) * 100.

functions.name: strategy.opentrades.max_runup
functions.description: Returns the maximum run up of the open trade, i.e., the maximum possible profit during the trade, expressed in strategy.account_currency.

functions.name: strategy.opentrades.max_runup_percent
functions.description: Returns the maximum run-up of the open trade, i.e., the maximum possible profit during the trade, expressed as a percentage and calculated by formula: Highest Value During Trade / (Entry Price x Quantity) * 100.

functions.name: strategy.opentrades.profit
functions.description: Returns the profit/loss of the open trade, expressed in strategy.account_currency. Losses are expressed as negative values.

functions.name: strategy.opentrades.profit_percent
functions.description: Returns the profit/loss of the open trade, expressed as a percentage. Losses are expressed as negative values.

functions.name: strategy.opentrades.size
functions.description: Returns the direction and the number of contracts traded in the open trade. If the value is > 0, the market position was long. If the value is < 0, the market position was short.

functions.name: strategy.order
functions.description: Creates a new order to open, add to, or exit from a position. If an unfilled order with the same id exists, a call to this command modifies that order.

functions.name: strategy.risk.allow_entry_in
functions.description: This function can be used to specify in which market direction the strategy.entry function is allowed to open positions.

functions.name: strategy.risk.max_cons_loss_days
functions.description: The purpose of this rule is to cancel all pending orders, close all open positions and stop placing orders after a specified number of consecutive days with losses. The rule affects the whole strategy.

functions.name: strategy.risk.max_drawdown
functions.description: The purpose of this rule is to determine maximum drawdown. The rule affects the whole strategy. Once the maximum drawdown value is reached, all pending orders are cancelled, all open positions are closed and no new orders can be placed.

functions.name: strategy.risk.max_intraday_filled_orders
functions.description: The purpose of this rule is to determine maximum number of filled orders per 1 day (per 1 bar, if chart resolution is higher than 1 day). The rule affects the whole strategy. Once the maximum number of filled orders is reached, all pending orders are cancelled, all open positions are closed and no new orders can be placed till the end of the current trading session.

functions.name: strategy.risk.max_intraday_loss
functions.description: The maximum loss value allowed during a day. It is specified either in money (base currency), or in percentage of maximum intraday equity (0 -100).

functions.name: strategy.risk.max_position_size
functions.description: The purpose of this rule is to determine maximum size of a market position. The rule affects the following function: strategy.entry. The 'entry' quantity can be reduced (if needed) to such number of contracts/shares/lots/units, so the total position size doesn't exceed the value specified in 'strategy.risk.max_position_size'. If minimum possible quantity still violates the rule, the order will not be placed.

functions.name: string
functions.description: Casts na to string

functions.name: syminfo.prefix
functions.description: Returns exchange prefix of the symbol, e.g. "NASDAQ".

functions.name: syminfo.ticker
functions.description: Returns symbol name without exchange prefix, e.g. "AAPL".

functions.name: ta.alma
functions.description: Arnaud Legoux Moving Average. It uses Gaussian distribution as weights for moving average.

functions.name: ta.atr
functions.description: Function atr (average true range) returns the RMA of true range. True range is max(high - low, abs(high - close[1]), abs(low - close[1])).

functions.name: ta.barssince
functions.description: Counts the number of bars since the last time the condition was true.

functions.name: ta.bb
functions.description: Bollinger Bands. A Bollinger Band is a technical analysis tool defined by a set of lines plotted two standard deviations (positively and negatively) away from a simple moving average (SMA) of the security's price, but can be adjusted to user preferences.

functions.name: ta.bbw
functions.description: Bollinger Bands Width. The Bollinger Band Width is the difference between the upper and the lower Bollinger Bands divided by the middle band.

functions.name: ta.cci
functions.description: The CCI (commodity channel index) is calculated as the difference between the typical price of a commodity and its simple moving average, divided by the mean absolute deviation of the typical price. The index is scaled by an inverse factor of 0.015 to provide more readable numbers.

functions.name: ta.change
functions.description: Compares the current source value to its value length bars ago and returns the difference.

functions.name: ta.cmo
functions.description: Chande Momentum Oscillator. Calculates the difference between the sum of recent gains and the sum of recent losses and then divides the result by the sum of all price movement over the same period.

functions.name: ta.cog
functions.description: The cog (center of gravity) is an indicator based on statistics and the Fibonacci golden ratio.

functions.name: ta.correlation
functions.description: Correlation coefficient. Describes the degree to which two series tend to deviate from their ta.sma values.

functions.name: ta.crossover
functions.description: The source1-series is defined as having crossed over source2-series if, on the current bar, the value of source1 is greater than the value of source2, and on the previous bar, the value of source1 was less than or equal to the value of source2.

functions.name: ta.crossunder
functions.description: The source1-series is defined as having crossed under source2-series if, on the current bar, the value of source1 is less than the value of source2, and on the previous bar, the value of source1 was greater than or equal to the value of source2.

functions.name: ta.cum
functions.description: Cumulative (total) sum of source. In other words it's a sum of all elements of source.

functions.name: ta.dev
functions.description: Measure of difference between the series and it's ta.sma

functions.name: ta.dmi
functions.description: The dmi function returns the directional movement index.

functions.name: ta.ema
functions.description: The ema function returns the exponentially weighted moving average. In ema weighting factors decrease exponentially. It calculates by using a formula: EMA = alpha * source + (1 - alpha) * EMA[1], where alpha = 2 / (length + 1).

functions.name: ta.falling
functions.description: Test if the source series is now falling for length bars long.

functions.name: ta.highest
functions.description: Highest value for a given number of bars back.

functions.name: ta.highestbars
functions.description: Highest value offset for a given number of bars back.

functions.name: ta.hma
functions.description: The hma function returns the Hull Moving Average.

functions.name: ta.kc
functions.description: Keltner Channels. Keltner channel is a technical analysis indicator showing a central moving average line plus channel lines at a distance above and below.

functions.name: ta.kcw
functions.description: Keltner Channels Width. The Keltner Channels Width is the difference between the upper and the lower Keltner Channels divided by the middle channel.

functions.name: ta.linreg
functions.description: Linear regression curve. A line that best fits the prices specified over a user-defined time period. It is calculated using the least squares method. The result of this function is calculated using the formula: linreg = intercept + slope * (length - 1 - offset), where intercept and slope are the values calculated with the least squares method on source series.

functions.name: ta.lowest
functions.description: Lowest value for a given number of bars back.

functions.name: ta.lowestbars
functions.description: Lowest value offset for a given number of bars back.

functions.name: ta.macd
functions.description: MACD (moving average convergence/divergence). It is supposed to reveal changes in the strength, direction, momentum, and duration of a trend in a stock's price.

functions.name: ta.max
functions.description: Returns the all-time high value of source from the beginning of the chart up to the current bar.

functions.name: ta.median
functions.description: Returns the median of the series.

functions.name: ta.mfi
functions.description: Money Flow Index. The Money Flow Index (MFI) is a technical oscillator that uses price and volume for identifying overbought or oversold conditions in an asset.

functions.name: ta.min
functions.description: Returns the all-time low value of source from the beginning of the chart up to the current bar.

functions.name: ta.mode
functions.description: Returns the mode of the series. If there are several values with the same frequency, it returns the smallest value.

functions.name: ta.mom
functions.description: Momentum of source price and source price length bars ago. This is simply a difference: source - source[length].

functions.name: ta.percentile_linear_interpolation
functions.description: Calculates percentile using method of linear interpolation between the two nearest ranks.

functions.name: ta.percentile_nearest_rank
functions.description: Calculates percentile using method of Nearest Rank.

functions.name: ta.percentrank
functions.description: Percent rank is the percents of how many previous values was less than or equal to the current value of given series.

functions.name: ta.pivot_point_levels
functions.description: Calculates the pivot point levels using the specified type and anchor.

functions.name: ta.pivothigh
functions.description: This function returns price of the pivot high point. It returns 'NaN', if there was no pivot high point.

functions.name: ta.pivotlow
functions.description: This function returns price of the pivot low point. It returns 'NaN', if there was no pivot low point.

functions.name: ta.range
functions.description: Returns the difference between the min and max values in a series.

functions.name: ta.rci
functions.description: Calculates the Rank Correlation Index (RCI), which measures the directional consistency of price movements. It evaluates the monotonic relationship between a source series and the bar index over length bars using Spearman's rank correlation coefficient. The resulting value is scaled to a range of -100 to 100, where 100 indicates the source consistently increased over the period, and -100 indicates it consistently decreased. Values between -100 and 100 reflect varying degrees of upward or downward consistency.

functions.name: ta.rising
functions.description: Test if the source series is now rising for length bars long.

functions.name: ta.rma
functions.description: Moving average used in RSI. It is the exponentially weighted moving average with alpha = 1 / length.

functions.name: ta.roc
functions.description: Calculates the percentage of change (rate of change) between the current value of source and its value length bars ago.

functions.name: ta.rsi
functions.description: Relative strength index. It is calculated using the ta.rma() of upward and downward changes of source over the last length bars.

functions.name: ta.sar
functions.description: Parabolic SAR (parabolic stop and reverse) is a method devised by J. Welles Wilder, Jr., to find potential reversals in the market price direction of traded goods.

functions.name: ta.sma
functions.description: The sma function returns the moving average, that is the sum of last y values of x, divided by y.

functions.name: ta.stoch
functions.description: Stochastic. It is calculated by a formula: 100 * (close - lowest(low, length)) / (highest(high, length) - lowest(low, length)).

functions.name: ta.supertrend
functions.description: The Supertrend Indicator. The Supertrend is a trend following indicator.

functions.name: ta.swma
functions.description: Symmetrically weighted moving average with fixed length: 4. Weights: [1/6, 2/6, 2/6, 1/6].

functions.name: ta.tr
functions.description: Calculates the current bar's true range. Unlike a bar's actual range (high - low), true range accounts for potential gaps by taking the maximum of the current bar's actual range and the absolute distances from the previous bar's close to the current bar's high and low. The formula is: math.max(high - low, math.abs(high - close[1]), math.abs(low - close[1]))

functions.name: ta.tsi
functions.description: True strength index. It uses moving averages of the underlying momentum of a financial instrument.

functions.name: ta.valuewhen
functions.description: Returns the value of the source series on the bar where the condition was true on the nth most recent occurrence.

functions.name: ta.variance
functions.description: Variance is the expectation of the squared deviation of a series from its mean (ta.sma), and it informally measures how far a set of numbers are spread out from their mean.

functions.name: ta.vwap
functions.description: Volume weighted average price.

functions.name: ta.vwma
functions.description: The vwma function returns volume-weighted moving average of source for length bars back. It is the same as: sma(source * volume, length) / sma(volume, length).

functions.name: ta.wma
functions.description: The wma function returns weighted moving average of source for length bars back. In wma weighting factors decrease in arithmetical progression.

functions.name: ta.wpr
functions.description: Williams %R. The oscillator shows the current closing price in relation to the high and low of the past 'length' bars.

functions.name: table
functions.description: Casts na to table

functions.name: table.cell
functions.description: The function defines a cell in the table and sets its attributes.

functions.name: table.cell_set_bgcolor
functions.description: The function sets the background color of the cell.

functions.name: table.cell_set_height
functions.description: The function sets the height of cell.

functions.name: table.cell_set_text
functions.description: The function sets the text in the specified cell.

functions.name: table.cell_set_text_color
functions.description: The function sets the color of the text inside the cell.

functions.name: table.cell_set_text_font_family
functions.description: The function sets the font family of the text inside the cell.

functions.name: table.cell_set_text_formatting
functions.description: Sets the formatting attributes the drawing applies to displayed text.

functions.name: table.cell_set_text_halign
functions.description: The function sets the horizontal alignment of the cell's text.

functions.name: table.cell_set_text_size
functions.description: The function sets the size of the cell's text.

functions.name: table.cell_set_text_valign
functions.description: The function sets the vertical alignment of a cell's text.

functions.name: table.cell_set_tooltip
functions.description: The function sets the tooltip in the specified cell.

functions.name: table.cell_set_width
functions.description: The function sets the width of the cell.

functions.name: table.clear
functions.description: The function removes a cell or a sequence of cells from the table. The cells are removed in a rectangle shape where the start_column and start_row specify the top-left corner, and end_column and end_row specify the bottom-right corner.

functions.name: table.delete
functions.description: The function deletes a table.

functions.name: table.merge_cells
functions.description: The function merges a sequence of cells in the table into one cell. The cells are merged in a rectangle shape where the start_column and start_row specify the top-left corner, and end_column and end_row specify the bottom-right corner.

functions.name: table.new
functions.description: The function creates a new table.

functions.name: table.set_bgcolor
functions.description: The function sets the background color of a table.

functions.name: table.set_border_color
functions.description: The function sets the color of the borders (excluding the outer frame) of the table's cells.

functions.name: table.set_border_width
functions.description: The function sets the width of the borders (excluding the outer frame) of the table's cells.

functions.name: table.set_frame_color
functions.description: The function sets the color of the outer frame of a table.

functions.name: table.set_frame_width
functions.description: The function set the width of the outer frame of a table.

functions.name: table.set_position
functions.description: The function sets the position of a table.

functions.name: ticker.heikinashi
functions.description: Creates a ticker identifier for requesting Heikin Ashi bar values.

functions.name: ticker.inherit
functions.description: Constructs a ticker ID for the specified symbol with additional parameters inherited from the ticker ID passed into the function call, allowing the script to request a symbol's data using the same modifiers that the from_tickerid has, including extended session, dividend adjustment, currency conversion, non-standard chart types, back-adjustment, settlement-as-close, etc.

functions.name: ticker.kagi
functions.description: Creates a ticker identifier for requesting Kagi values.

functions.name: ticker.linebreak
functions.description: Creates a ticker identifier for requesting Line Break values.

functions.name: ticker.modify
functions.description: Creates a ticker identifier for requesting additional data for the script.

functions.name: ticker.new
functions.description: Creates a ticker identifier for requesting additional data for the script.

functions.name: ticker.pointfigure
functions.description: Creates a ticker identifier for requesting Point & Figure values.

functions.name: ticker.renko
functions.description: Creates a ticker identifier for requesting Renko values.

functions.name: ticker.standard
functions.description: Creates a ticker to request data from a standard chart that is unaffected by modifiers like extended session, dividend adjustment, currency conversion, and the calculations of non-standard chart types: Heikin Ashi, Renko, etc. Among other things, this makes it possible to retrieve standard chart values when the script is running on a non-standard chart.

functions.name: time
functions.description: The time function returns the UNIX time of the current bar for the specified timeframe and session or NaN if the time point is out of session.

functions.name: time_close
functions.description: Returns the UNIX time of the current bar's close for the specified timeframe and session, or na if the time point is outside the session. On tick charts and price-based charts such as Renko, line break, Kagi, point & figure, and range, this function returns an na timestamp for the latest realtime bar (because the future closing time is unpredictable), but a valid timestamp for any previous bar.

functions.name: timeframe.change
functions.description: Detects changes in the specified timeframe.

functions.name: timeframe.from_seconds
functions.description: Converts a number of seconds into a valid timeframe string.

functions.name: timeframe.in_seconds
functions.description: Converts a timeframe string into seconds.

functions.name: timestamp
functions.description: Function timestamp returns UNIX time of specified date and time.
